diff --git a/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc b/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc
index cf1cc9f8..11331023 100644
--- a/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc
@@ -50,6 +50,11 @@ indexing and search. As a result, all document counts include hidden
 To get an accurate count of {es} documents, use the <<cat-count,cat count>> or
 <<search-count,count>> APIs.
 
+NOTE: Indices restored from <<snapshots-source-only-repository,source-only snapshots>> 
+will not display statistics for `docs.count`, `docs.deleted`, `store.size`, and 
+`pri.store.size` because source-only indices do not support the full suite of index 
+statistics. These fields will appear empty in the output.
+
 
 [[cat-indices-api-path-params]]
 ==== {api-path-parms-title}
diff --git a/docs/reference/snapshot-restore/repository-source-only.asciidoc b/docs/reference/snapshot-restore/repository-source-only.asciidoc
index 04e53c42..f33ab42a 100644
--- a/docs/reference/snapshot-restore/repository-source-only.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/snapshot-restore/repository-source-only.asciidoc
@@ -27,6 +27,10 @@ As a result, indices adopting synthetic source cannot be restored. When you rest
  * The mapping of the restored index is empty, but the original mapping is available from the types top
    level `meta` element.
 
+ * The <<cat-indices,`_cat/indices` API>> will not display statistics such as `docs.count`, `docs.deleted`, 
+   `store.size`, and `pri.store.size` for source-only indices because they do not support the full suite of 
+   index statistics.
+
 ==================================================
